The owner Mitch and the entire staff are friendly, helpful and ready to share their thoughtful recommendations with their patrons. Service is on point with no empty glasses left unattended.
**************Look for their Chef, JP Miron, on upcoming TOP CHEF***********
Beef Tartare - we were so hungry we devoured it before taking any photos. Prime minced beef with licorice herb notes.
Batatas Brava - roasted potatoes with tomato aioli...again devoured prior to photo.
Cacio E Pepe - black pepper and black truffle pasta that would be the pride & joy of any authentic Italian chef.
Sea Bass - Mediterranean style with perfectly crisp skin and Smokey accompaniment with fresh endive and thinly sliced green apple.
Special of the Day - Seared scallops and a satisfying pea & mirepoix that is light yet hearty. I loved every bite of this dish.
Donuts with dulce de leche - almost impossible that this doughy goodness is not cloyingly sweet given the cinnamon sugar and golden caramel sauce.
Half baked chocolate chip cookie with house made Bourbon ice cream. Ice cream and melt in my mouth chocolate...just get it.

This was an inaugural dinner to be remembered.
#SommsofAnarchy

Came here with six colleagues for what was probably the best meal I've ever had in Montreal.  It's a very charming restaurant with attentive and caring service and creative menu.  My visit was a while ago, so unfortunately I don't recall a lot of detail, but I look forward to returning someday.

The food here was fantastic, appetizer of mushrooms on French bread with caramelized onions topped with truffles. Main course of a lobster roll and clam chowder. Glass of red wine. Excellent and friendly service; very professional. Absolutely loved it!

Am in town for a short getaway-- and came across this place when looking at a place that would be close to my hotel on a rainy night--- and was NOT disappointed - this place was INCREDIBLE-  it felt like a touch of Barcelona (patatas bravas)- blended with a twist of Montreal-  and a dash of home!  As someone who is surrounded by great restaurants at home in NYC - I don't generally make a resie twice at one place on vacation- this is the kind of place that merits a second visit !

Stumbled upon this place last week while I was Montreal for business. 

Cool place- atmosphere is really neat and inviting. I sat down at the bar and said "looks like a nice place to have a few cocktails". The bartender quickly came back with "sorry, if you want to drink you also have to order food, it's the law". Hmmm ok. I wasn't planning on eating, but this was a blessing in disguise. 

Started out with a RYE Manhattan. She made a really good drink. I then ordered the lobster and ham carbonara. YUM. SHIT WAS GOOOOOOOD. lobster was super tender and the ham added a nice salty taste. 

I would for sure come back here for a meal!

And they give you your bill in an old book....

I think there are better places in town if you want a full, hearty meal, but I can't imagine many places better than Bocata for grabbing a great glass of wine, sharing some small plates, and pretending you're in France (without the jetlag).

We had basically all of the charcuterie, and also had the octopus salad, and burrata, and they were superb (but when is burrata not superb?...).  The atmosphere here is great, especially on a nice night when the windows are open, and it's great to stroll around old Montreal after the meal.

Tres bien!

Food: 4/5
Value: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Atmosphere: 5/5

The rustic, cozy charm of Bocata comes mostly from an exposed stone wall from the 1700s (or so I was told). My only decor complaint was the plastic prosciutto leg hanging over the bar. Why do restaurants do that??? 

Everything I tried was excellent, but the dishes ARE small. The scallops were crispy on the outside, tender inside. And the oysters were sooooo clean and mellow. Even one of my dining companions who doesn't like oysters devoured her share. The foie gras was unctuous. My only complaint was that there wasn't enough! And the salmon tare tare had a lovely, but not overpowering, sprinkling of fresh dill. 

While I didn't flip through the wine list, I saw it from across the table and it was a friggin novel. I'm glad I wasn't in charge of picking! 

I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for carefully prepared, high-quality food. If you want quantity, head elsewhere.

Loved this cozy little place. Two of us walked in without a reservation at 8 on a Saturday. Got seated in minutes. 

We had the charcuterie and cheese played which were served with warm bread with olive oil -- so delicious. The cavetelli with mushrooms -- perfection and the chocolate bread pudding -- very good. 

Also had a glass of wine. Enjoyed this place immensely. Might be my favorite stop during my time in Montreal.
Great location, cool vibe.  The waiter was very helpful.  I enjoyed the food and the wine, particularly the lemon tart which was out of this world.  Highly recommend!

Nestled along the famous Rue St. Paul, is a quaint restaurant where you will no doubt have a fantastic meal.

Look for the lit up "B" and you will find, Bocata, a Spanish influenced bistro.

With only a few tables, be sure to make your reservation days in advance.

Bocata offers small plates and some entrees that are large enough to share. 

We started with the crab cakes. The order comes with only 2. They were very flavorful and make with true crab meat. Very pleased these were not heavy on mayo, which is what you see a lot.

We also ordered 15g of the cured meat. It reminded me of the jamon in Spain and Paris. Melts in your mouth!

For our main course, we shared the veal chop served with gnocchi. Wow! This was amazing. The veal was so tender. And the gnocchi was simply wonderful.

Finally, we ended with the frozen nougat. It was nice and not too sweet.

Absolutely recommended! 

My group of 7 had an exceptional experience- from booking the table for my wife's birthday to the service, quality of the food, and the fantastic ambience in Old Montreal.

We're a group of self-professed foodies and wanted to indulge in a great Montreal meal where we could try a wide variety of dishes. Bocata's small plates (and even the entree sized dishes) were perfect for this. We came to Montreal from (respectively) Chicago, NYC, and Washington, DC, so are no strangers to good eats. This was truly one of the best food experiences I've ever had and the perfect choice for our crew. 

After researching where to eat, I emailed Veronique about two weeks in advance to make sure the restaurant could accommodate us and she was very helpful and responsive. Our reservation was for 9 at first, but a few friends had emergencies and couldn't make it- there were no issues emailing Veronique to  update our reservation. 

Upon arrival, we were seated right away. The server(s) we had were knowledgable and gave us lots of tips and recommendations. I wish I had caught both of their names! They took excellent care of our group.

We opted not to order entrees in the traditional manner, but instead ordered plates in 3 or so courses, over a period of time and shared them family style among the entire group so we could all taste as many items as possible. We ordered at our leisure and never felt rushed- we were really able to enjoy all the entire experience. 

All of the items we tried were outstanding, but the highlights definitely included the lobster and fennel tagliatelle,  the osso bucco (the large portion was perfect for sharing with 7), and the squid ink risotto (we loved it so much, we ordered two plates). The smoked duck confit salad was also a table favorite. 

Most of us started with a cocktail- mine was the classic old fashioned- really well done. 

We then switched to wine. While I'd say we are wine lovers, many of the wines listed were way beyond accessible, and that is the only reason I didn't give Bocata 5 stars. Some of the less expensive bottles were only "meh", and even those were priced around $45/50 each. I would have liked to have had more options at  a lower price point. We splurged BIG on the food and so wanted to keep things a bit more reasonable on the drink side of things, which was difficult. 

We did have a bubbly toast for my wife, and selected a pinot noir varietal, which was really nice. 

All in all, everyone left satisfied and happy- it was a truly enjoyable experience from top to bottom and I hope to make it back to Montreal in the future so I can visit the sister restaurant located next door!

Thank you, Bocata!

I was excited to try Bocata since I loved barocco so much !  We went for dinner and sat at the bar on a Saturday. The decor was casual chic and very comfortable. The first thing that struck me is that this was a beautiful date restaurant with dim lighting and just a very nice vibe. We started with the octopus and potatoes  (great cook on the octopus but the potatoes were a touch underdone). I had the lobster carbonara which was delicious perfectly cooked lobster and pasta with great flavour. My boyfriend had the lobster boil dish and while the food was fresh and there was nothing wrong with it , he did say it lacked some spicing or something to make it stand out a little more. We also had the donuts for dessert which were nice and light and not overly sweet , they were a nice ending to the meal.  We had really great friendly service and they made a great wine suggestion for us. My only complaint is that I felt that it was a touch overpriced for what you get but definitely go in and try for yourself !
One of the best meals I have ever had! The service was great, the food was absolutely outstanding. Such good flavor combinations. If I am ever back in Montreal, I will certainly dine here again!

Quaint, charming, romantic, adorable...are some of the adjectives I will use to describe this place. It reminded me of a bistro one might find in France.
We stayed around the corner and dropped in for brunch! 
We were not disappointed!
The staff was friendly and hospitable!
Shout out to our waiter, Eli and the hostess!!!
Our meals were delicious and creatively presented.
They also served us warm, fresh baked bread.

Can't wait to come back to Montreal and try this place for dinner!
Merci

We definitely had one of the best restaurant experiences ever at Bocata on our vacation in Montreal. Coming from Los Angeles we were totally uncertain what the restaurant scene would be in Canada. Bocata definitely blew us away. The atmosphere was cozy, quaint and well-styled. The staff was helpful, attentive and fun. The music was honestly the best playlist I've ever heard in a restaurant. The food was delicious and special. Cannot recommend this awesome spot enough!!!!

Best waitress on the planet!  Pretty presentation, yummy on the tongue, nice sized portions, good value.  Love the brick walls, quaint atmosphere and space around the tables.  We go here at least twice a year when we are in Montreal.

I don't think I've given a five star review before.  Ever.   But this place warrants it.  The thing that makes it great is that the staff seemed to really care about the work they were doing and the food they brought out.   At our table, for apps we had a special duck confit salad (which seems like it's a fairly common special), and fried smelt. Both were awesome in their own right.  Especially the salad, which may qualify as life-changing.  

Entrees were roasted cod, squid ink risotto with various shellfish, roasted seabass with a creamy sweet potato topper, and a basic kids pasta, which in reality was a tasty tagliatelle pomodoro. 

Excellent wine selection, if a bit pricey.  We had a few off the by-the-glass menu which were delicious.  

To seal the deal, we had the chocolate lava cake and tiramisu.  Both were delicious.  We finished off with some Taylor Fladgate 10 year old Porto, which is always nice.  A decent selection of after-dinner drinks if that is your thing.      

As others have written, the portions here are not big.  They are appropriately sized to give you a delicious and fulfilling meal.  If you want to strap a feedbag on your face, you can try Buffalo Wild Wings or something.  We took our time and we never felt rushed.  On a Sunday night, they turned away at least 25 people.  They could've tried to move the tables, but that never happened.

If I had this place down the street I think I would stop in weekly! The decor and ambiance is that perfect touch of European rustic/farm. This small restaurant also has a great selection of wine by the glass at affordable prices, and although a little expensive, nothing on the menu disappointed.
Best place I have been to in Montreal. The atmosphere is so cozy, real, and authentic. Can't wait to come back. The service is amazingly friendly.

There are not enough words in the English or French dictionary to sum up our feelings about Bocata Restaurant and Wine Bar.  We plan random visits to Montreal just so we can eat there!  This is one of those rare restaurants you discover and everything about it just stays with you.  We love the food, the wine and the staff--especially Andreane! 

Bocata is my favorite restaurant in Montreal and possibly the world!  Every meal I've had has been memorable.  Here are some of my favorite dishes:

Citrus Risotto with Scallops, Verbena Emulsion
Don't let the foam fool you!  These scallops were sooooo good!  We got to try these from the Valentine's Day Menu and they should be the everyday menu.

Lobster & Fennel Tagliatelle
We had no problem eating off of other people's dishes to try this delicious dish.  We just pretended there were no carbs.  This goodness is on the summer menu so you need to get it while you still can!

Mediterranean Sea Bass
This is also part of the summer menu.  You can lose a friendship over this one if you don't feel like sharing.  The vanilla infused sweet potato puree was perfect.

Burata
A featured appetizer on the summer menu.  The Burata is quite filling and tasty!  Don't worry, the bread doesn't have any carbs.

Asparagus with Quail Eggs
Had dreams about the asparagus.  There is truffle oil in there somewhere.  We went two days in a row just to eat this again.

Foie Gras Poele Aux Argumes
Okay, we love our foie gras but this one really changed our lives.  Orange marmalade  Bourbon and Maple jus and GINGERBREAD CRUMBLE.  To our Foie Gras Fairy Godmother or Godfather out there, we are willing to sacrifice a lot just to have a taste again. 

Amuse Bouche
Although this was just an amuse bouche, we knew that the rest of our meal would be perfect because they got this part right!

Surf & Turf 
So what do you get when you pair AAA Angus Beef Tenderloin with celery root puree and Roasted Lobster with Almond & Truffle Viennoise?  The perfect pair!

Sweet Treat
Warm chocolaty brownies with salted caramel and ice cream.  What more can a girl ask for?  And yes, the dessert had zero carbs as well.


We are just so in love with Bocata Restaurant et Bar a vin all we can say is Oh My Bocata!  We can't wait to go back!

Amazing place! Perfect to grab a glass of wine or five and read a book while watching the crowds in Old Montreal! The food is fresh and the Burrata is the best I've ever had! Mitch is the Sommelier and has impeccable taste in wine. His rotating wine list is exceptional. If you want to try them a they pour 1/2 glasses as well. Julia is a phenomenal waitress and makes you feel right at home! All this with a great old world ambience. You really can't go wrong. Cheers!

Bocata... What a fantastic meal! One of the rare 5 star reviews. 

The service is great. The decor is cozy and very nice.

We had a bit of everything:
Pata negra: freshly cut and fabulous! 
Pan con tomate: tasty and fresh.
Crab croquette: plenty of excellent crab, no fillers.
Duck salad: very good with many flavours going on.
Tuna tartare: absolutely fabulous!!!! I am still thinking about how good it was! My favourite part of the meal. 
Lobster roll: very good, but the side corn and cheese salad was not really to our taste.
Lobster carbonara: very good. 

If I had one criticism, for the sake of criticizing something, it would be a little too much mayo in the lobster roll. 

I will be going back... Can't wait! Enjoy!

We ate here twice during our stay in Old Montreal because it was that fantastic!  Definitely recommend sitting at the bar and watching the staff make their fantastic cocktails!  Try their cocktail of the day and an English mojito!!  For starters, we had the duck confit salad (best salad I've ever, ever had), octopus and arugula salad, oysters, pata negra (it's almost like prosciutto but less salty and smoother), and burrata (almost a cross between cream cheese, sour cream and mozzarella, a must have for cheese lovers).  For dinner we had the black cod and the veal shank with gnocchi and buffalo mozzarella, both were absolutely outstanding.  For dessert, we had the tiramisu and wished we could lick the bottom of the jar it came in.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu and if you have questions the staff is happy to explain anything.  We love wine but aren't quite connoisseurs yet, so we asked for recommendations based on what we do know we like and we were not disappointed with what they brought out for us.

Loved the warm homey atmosphere. We got the tuna tartare as our entree and then I had the veau with homemade gnocchi. The tuna was amazing. The veau was quite fatty but once you cut around that the meat was delicious. The gnocchi melted in your mouth and the piece de resistance was the fresh buffalo mozzarella they added to it. Great glass of Bordeaux wine that was only $5. We sat at the bar where the staff was attentive and friendly. 

My only complaint was I am only 5'4 so there wasn't anywhere that I could comfortably reach to rest my feet as we sat at the bar.

I went here for dinner last night with my mother. It was such a pleasant experience! The waitress was very kind, and took the time to explain various plates to us. We split the salmon appetizer which was so delicate and refreshing. We both had the lobster roll. Super delicious! The waitress gave us a complimentary dessert which also hit the spot. I highly recommend this spot!

We've been here twice on trips to Montreal and both times had outstanding meals.  The food has always been well prepared.  The atmosphere is perfect for a special night out.  Cozy and eclectic...this restaurant is a little pricey but well worth it.

We arrived without reservation, but luckily grabbed a table for two by the bar. This restaurant is tastefully decorated and not lacking for details. Out server greeted us and let us know the sommelier was present should we have any questions. This a tapas-style restaurant and our server suggested 2-4 plates a person. The two of us shared three plus a bottle of wine and dessert and were definitely satisfied. Our first two plates were a variety of five tomatoes with truffle oil and the duck and arugula. Both were absolutely fantastic! To follow we had the beef cheek. I dont have words to describe this dish. The beef was melt-in-your mouth delicious while the sauce it came with begged to be sopped up by bread which soon followed - two types to be precise. 
Our dessert (although not necessary) was a strawberry shortcake. This dish was just ok, but it did have to follow those beef cheeks. I would have had those for dessert.
Overall, I would recommend this restaurant, but be sure to make a reservation to avoid disappointment.

We wanted a delicious but laid back dinner, and we scored at Bocata! We were able to go without a reservation on a Wednesday night. We started with the special appetizer- panzanella. The tomatoes were delicious, but the dish was too salty. The buratta was very good- it's served with anchovies (which I personally don't like but my wife does!). 
The halibut special main course was amazing! Perfectly cooked fish over asparagus and ricotta- yum! Our server was super friendly, and the restaurant is so cute and cozy.
I am not sure was it me or the food was not all that. We went there for brunch and there was only limited choices to chose from. We were group of 12 and no one liked their food.

We had dinner here for the very first time.  Decor is warm, homey, rustic, hip & eclectic.
Candles in the fireplace & on the tables.   Wait staff very enthusiastic.  Food is unique & fabulous.  I had sea bass with a salad of lentils & beans.  Bread is fantastic too.  Dessert was the best lemon merange ever in tart form.  Only downside is noise level.  Located in Vieux Montreal on a cobblestone street - quaint.

Great food, great service, great vibe, great music! What else can I say? Everything was great!  Hubby had squid ink risotto with squid and scallops. I had lobster carbonara with bits of lardon. Such a laid back vibe with great music.

First time in Montreal, stumbled upon this place by accident for dinner with my family. The ambience and decor were adorable and intimate. The food was incredible and so fresh. We shared fried smelts as an appetizer (must try) and I had a glass of Riesling and the thyme roasted seabass as an entree. Service was great as well, would be a romantic date spot!

The concierge at Hotel Gault recommended Bocata, and I'm glad he did--I don't think I would have tried it given the lack of Yelp coverage. We had a great experience: relaxed, intimate room, friendly service, and a great sommelier who imports small-batch wines from France. The portions are between tapas and a regular entree. My wife and I split five between us, and were happy. The oysters were fantastic, as was the Halibut and heirloom tomato salad. The short rib and filet, and the carbonara were very good. Highly recommended.

We dined here for our 15 year wedding anniversary. Good thing the weather was bearable because the restaurant was open air & I wasnt expecting that otherwise I would've dressed a little lighter. The service was fantastic! The girl that waited on us was very informative and attentive. We were welcomed with two glasses of bubbly. We ordered the burrata w/ white anchovies & shaved summer truffle. We didn't taste a hint of truffle. The serving was plenty but I wouldn't order that again. My husband order the pork chop & I ordered the lobster carbonara. The portion on the carbonara was pretty small which I should watch my portion size anyways but with the small amount of lobster in it (I counted 3 small pieces) it shouldn't have been $30. Each dish we had the sommelier paired wine by the glass which they had us sample first before selecting & that was great! For dessert we had the lemon meringue torte, the lemon filling & meringue was great but we didn't care for the puff pastry it was on, it was too hard to cut through. All in all I loved the ambiance but would maybe come back for a bottle of wine to share with appitizers & dessert.

The ambiance of this restaurant is super charming and the service was great. My husband and I had some wine, split the Burrata, beef tartare, and octopus appetizers and he ordered the lobster roll and I got the squid ink risotto. The burrata was amazing and was from a local farm and served with anchovies and warm bread - delicious! The octopus was just ok. It was seasoned with paprika and served with potatoes and an aioli sauce. It was not Bad but nothing memorable either. The beef tartare was good, but the chunks of beef were bigger than typical for tartare and seasoning very European but yummy. the squid ink risotto was so/so. It's a heavy dish and was mixed with some sort of aioli sauce and came with cherry tomatoes peas seafood and chorizo. The seafood/meat was all good but the risotto pasta was undercooked and sauce was very heavy and too rich. My husband like the lobster roll - said It was good but not great. Overall food is good, and ambiance is great. I personally would not return for the food but loved the charm of the restaurant's atmosphere!
Stumbled in here searching for brunch and it was a hidden gem. The ambience and decor were very cute and comfortable. The food was diverse and creative for brunch and portioned perfectly.
